title: Two fishing boats seized with narcotics off southern coast brought to Dikkowita Harbour
byline: Two multi-day fishing trawlers along with 11 suspects, taken into custody by the Sri Lanka Navy on suspicion of transporting a large consignment of narcotics in deep seas off the southern coast, have been brought to the Dikkowita Fisheries Harbour.

title: Several spells of showers expected in parts of the island today
byline: Showers will occur at times in Northern, North-central, Eastern and Uva provinces and in Matale and Nuwara-Eliya districts, today (25), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Trump threatens Canada with 100% tariff over pending trade deal with China
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Saturday he would impose a 100% tariff on Canada if it follows through on a trade deal with China and warned Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney that a deal would endanger his country.

title: Federal immigration agents kill another US citizen in Minneapolis, sparking protests
byline: U.S. immigration agents shot and killed a U.S. citizen in Minneapolis on Saturday, officials said, sparking fierce protests and condemnations from local leaders in the second such incident this month.

title: Three arrested at BIA for attempting to smuggle ‘Kush’ and ‘Hashish’
byline: Three passengers attempting to smuggle a consignment of “Kush” and “Hashish” valued at Rs. 133.94 million into the country have been arrested at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) by Airport Customs officers and a group of officers of Customs Narcotics Control Unit.

title: Over 280 kg of drugs worth Rs. 4.5 bln recovered from intercepted fishing trawlers
byline: The two multi-day fishing trawlers and the 11 suspects taken into custody in deep seas off the southern coast and brought to the Dikkowita Fisheries Harbour have undergone further inspection, where the seized narcotics were weighed.

title: US storm leaves 160,000 without power, forces thousands of flight cancellations
byline: More than 4,000 flights were canceled in the U.S. on Saturday ahead of a monster winter storm that has already cut power to more than 160,000 electricity customers as far west as Texas, and threatened to paralyze eastern states with heavy snowfall.

title: 250 ‘Health and Wellness Centres’ to be established islandwide – Health Minister
byline: Minister of Health and Mass Media, Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa, says steps will be taken to establish 250 ‘Health and Wellness Centres’ across the country to strengthen preventive healthcare services.

title: Sri Lankan arrested with over 8 kg of ‘Kush’ at BIA
byline: A Sri Lankan has been arrested at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) for attempting to smuggle a consignment of ‘Kush’ cannabis with an estimated street value of Rs. 82.2 million, into the country.

title: Suspect arrested with micro pistol and ammunition in Ambalangoda
byline: A suspect has been arrested after a micro pistol and live ammunition was found concealed inside a room of a residence in the Wathugedara area of Ambalangoda.

title: Four including woman killed in separate road accidents
byline: Four people, including a woman, have been killed in separate road accidents reported from several areas, police said.

title: Shah Rukh Khan’s King release date announced
byline: The much-anticipated release date of Siddharth Anand’s King, led by Shah Rukh Khan, is out. Set to be a major festive release, the film will hit the screens on December 24, 2026.

title: Large number of local and foreign tourists visit Nuwara Eliya amid record low temperatures
byline: A large number of local and foreign tourists have visited Nuwara Eliya during the weekend holiday.

title: IFC announces investment program worth US$ 166 million to support Sri Lankan businesses
byline: The International Finance Corporation (IFC), a member of the World Bank Group, today announced a high-impact investment program of US$ 166 million to support Sri Lankan businesses and accelerate the country’s transition from economic stabilization to sustainable growth.

title: Today marks 28 years since LTTE bombing at Kandy Dalada Maligawa
byline: Today marks 28 years since the LTTE terrorists carried out a bomb attack on the historic Sri Dalada Maligawa (Temple of the Sacred Tooth Relic) in Kandy.

title: Govt to launch digital platform to guide village-level development projects
byline: The government has decided to introduce a new digital system to strengthen planning and oversight of village-level development projects under ‘Prajashakthi National Movement’, the President’s Media Division (PMD) said in a statement.

title: WHO chief says U.S. reasons for withdrawal ‘untrue’
byline: World Health Organization (WHO) Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus on Saturday depicted as ‘untrue’ the reasons given by the United States for its withdrawal from the global health watchdog.

title: Russian national drowns while swimming at Bentota Beach
byline: A Russian woman has died after drowning while swimming at Bentota Beach.

title: Last two giant pandas in Japan set to leave for China
byline: Japanese panda fans gathered Sunday for the final public viewing at Tokyo’s Ueno zoo before twins Xiao Xiao and Lei Lei return to China this week.

title: 443 arrested for driving under the influence during special island-wide raid
byline: A total of 571 individuals have been arrested on suspicion of being involved in criminal activities and also over illicit liquor and drug-related offenses during a special island-wide operation conducted yesterday (24).

title: Indian products must be synonymous with top quality: PM Modi
byline: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday urged industry and start ups to focus on quality and resolve to make excellence a benchmark in manufacturing.

title: GMOA to launch indefinite trade union action from tomorrow
byline: The Government Medical Officers Association (GMOA) has decided to launch an island-wide indefinite trade union action from tomorrow (January 26).

title: Climber Alex Honnold scales 101-floor skyscraper without safety gear
byline: American climber Alex Honnold has successfully scaled a Taiwan skyscraper without a rope, harness or safety equipment.

title: Shanakiyan raises concerns about move to suspend Deputy Secretary General of Parliament allegedly without an inquiry
byline: Member of Parliament Shanakiyan Rasamanickam has raised concerns about the decision to suspend Deputy Secretary General of Parliament and Chief of Staff Chaminda Kularatne from his post allegedly without a charge sheet, an inquiry, or even a right to be heard.

title: Six Gampaha Crimes Division arrested for allegedly assaulting Catholic priest
byline: Six officers of the Gampaha Division Crimes Investigation Bureau have been arrested for allegedly assaulting a Catholic priest, police stated.

title: Six police officers arrested for allegedly assaulting Catholic priest remanded
byline: Six police officers who were arrested for allegedly assaulting a Catholic priest have been remanded until tomorrow (26).

title: Myanmar’s junta leader dismisses critics as military allies head for landslide election win
byline: Myanmar’s junta chief on Sunday dismissed foreign criticism of the war-torn country’s general election as a final round of voting took place, with the military-backed party having secured a majority of seats in previous rounds.

title: Shooting reported at R.A.De Mel Mawatha in Kollupitiya
byline: A shooting has occurred at the R.A.D. Mel Mawatha in Kollupitiya this morning (25), police stated.

title: Fairly heavy showers above 50 mm likely in Western and Sabaragamuwa provinces tomorrow
byline: Showers will occur at times in the Northern, North-central, Eastern and Uva provinces and in the Matale and Nuwara-Eliya districts tomorrow (26), the Department of Meteorology stated.

title: Several injured following collision involving lorry and ambulance in Habarana
byline: An accident involving a lorry and an ambulance has been reported along the Dambulla–Habarana main road in Habarana, police stated.

title: Six Gampaha Crimes Division officers arrested for allegedly assaulting Catholic priest
byline: Six officers of the Gampaha Division Crimes Investigation Bureau have been arrested for allegedly assaulting a Catholic priest, police stated.

title: School closed in Nawalapitiya over landslide risk cleared to reopen after two months
byline: The National Building Research Organisation (NBRO) today (25) issued the necessary recommendation to recommence academic activities at the Anuruddha Kumara Primary School in Nawalapitiya, which had been closed for nearly two months due to the risk of a landslide.

title: Speaker interdicting Deputy Secretary General of Parliament without hearing sets dangerous precedent: Sajith
byline: The Speaker of House, Jagath Wickramaratne interdicting the Deputy Secretary General of Parliament and Chief of Staff, Chaminda Kularatne from his post, allegedly without even giving a hearing sets a dangerous precedent, the Leader of Opposition, Sajith Premadasa has stated.

title: Police Officer arrested in connection with priest assault incident suspended?
byline: An officer attached to the Gampaha Division Crimes Investigation Bureau’s motorcycle squad, who was taken into custody in connection with the alleged assault on a Catholic priest, has been suspended from duty.

title: Bangladesh criticises India over fugitive leader Hasina’s speech
byline: Bangladesh said on Sunday (Jan 25) it was “surprised” and “shocked” that India had allowed fugitive former prime minister Sheikh Hasina to make a public address in New Delhi.

title: Two Indian Coast Guard ships arrives in Colombo for official visit
byline: The Indian Coast Guard Ships (ICGS) Varaha and Atulya arrived today at the Colombo Harbour for an official visit and were welcomed in accordance with naval traditions by the Navy.

title: Quality deficiency identified in coal samples sent to India: Minister
byline: It has been confirmed that the coal samples sent to India in relation to the coal shipment that has sparked public debate have not met the required calorific value, the Minister of Health and Mass Media, Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa has said.

title: Man killed by a US Border Patrol officer in Minneapolis was an ICU nurse, family says
byline: Family members say the man killed by a U.S. Border Patrol officer in Minneapolis on Saturday was an intensive care nurse at a Veterans Affairs hospital who cared deeply about people and was upset by President Donald Trump’s immigration crackdown in his city.

title: Sri Lanka targets up to 100,000 UAE tourists in coming years
byline: The current consul general of Sri Lanka to Dubai is on a mission to ramp up the number of tourists coming from the UAE to the South Asian island nation. His aim is not only to double the number of visitors from 20,000 to 40,000 this year but also to reach as many as 100,000 annually in the coming years.

title: Pakistan Navy evacuates ailing Sri Lankan on merchant vessel
byline: The Pakistan Navy on Saturday successfully conducted the medical evacuation of a Sri Lankan national on the high seas, approximately 1,500 kilometres off Pakistan’s coast.

title: Complaints received regarding scams impersonating Deputy Minister
byline: Deputy Minister of Industry and Entrepreneurship Development Chathuranga Abeysinghe says that complaints have been received regarding a person who is impersonating him and committing financial fraud.
